oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military Pass for Mrs. Priest and Mrs. Moran
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Small document serving as a military pass allowing Mrs. Priest and Mrs. Moran to pass beyond the pickets on the Lewisburg Pike and to return. The pass was authorized by Major General Gordon Granger of the Army of Kentucky stationed at Franklin, Tennessee.

On October 7, 1862, Maj. Gen. Gordon Granger revived the name "Army of Kentucky." This unit was originally composed of three Union divisions that, on January 20, were attached to the larger Army of the Cumberland. Gordon Granger (1822-1876) was a career U.S. army officer and a Union general during the American Civil War. He distinguished himself at Chickamauga.
